paper.title: A Storage Complexity Based Analogue of Maurer Key Establishment Using Public Channels
paper.venue: Proceedings of the 5th IMA Conference on Cryptography and Coding
paper.abstract: We describe a key agreement system based on the assumption that there exists a public broadcast channel transmitting data at such a rate that an eavesdropper cannot economically store all the data sent over a certain time period. The two legitimate parties select bits randomly from this channel, and use as key bits those which they have selected in common. The work is inspired by recent work of Maurer, [3].
